Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel for a short stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: aga s
Reviews.Content: After reading many good on Trip Advisor i decided to book 3 nights stay for 2 people in Hotel Piave. It was easy to get to hotel from train station around 15min by walk. Our room was a bit small but for that price and in such a good localisation we couldn't complain. It looked exactly like in the pictures. Hotel seems to be new or refurbished not long time ago. Clean towels and bed linen. Nice fragrance of bath cosmetics. Breakfast was tasty, maybe selection was not big but the quality was good! Especially coffee or orange juice, better than in 4* hotels! For those looking for low budget hotel this place is perfect and i can really recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and friendly”
Reviews.Author: Tolgay
Reviews.Content: Very nice interesting small hotel located on the 3rd floor of 100 years fantastic building with a fancy elevator. It has a great location close to all attractive places. The rooms are a little bit small, but very clean. Breakfast is a big plus. It definitely worths more than 2 stars. Price is reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Tried hard but just didn't make it”
Reviews.Author: BlueMountainsSpirit
Reviews.Content: The owner was really friendly and helpful. A lift was a bonus with the luggage. I felt a little claustrophobic in this hotel as the rooms were pretty small and there was nowhere else to sit and relax. The shower was a massage type hard but good. The breaky was pretty good, croisants, salami, fresh fruits, bread, coffee and chocolate. The downside was that the airconditioning was not adequate even after we asked for it to be turned down. We heard other people complaining as well. It was really hot in Rome so we really needed this. Also we ordered a private car to the hotel for our really early flight to crete as there was no other transport available at this time but it was never organised and we were lucky that we flagged down a passing taxi at 5am in the morning. We nearly missed our flight so this was disappointing. It was a fair way from the metro but the buses were

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely PERFECT hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: Debra002
Reviews.Content: Beautiful old (newly and beautifully renovated) hotel for a 2 star budget hotel, the owners were absolutely wonderful and the inclusive breakfast was a great way to start the day. Great location, 2 minute walk to the bus stop (10 minute bus ride to all major attractions)and 10 minute walk (or couple minute / 5 Euro taxi ride) to Rome's main Termini Station (train, bus, taxi) where you can hop a fast train to many other Euopean destinations if you'd like. I highly recommend this hotel and this experience! Debra from So. California

Reviews.Title: “Cosy Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Adeona_J
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Albergo Piave for 4 nights for a pleasure trip in Rome. Albergo Piave is located in a beautiful residential area, nearby many embassies. We appreciated the quietness of the area after spending all day sightseeing in the busy streets of Rome. .The hotel is small, no thrills, but has everything you need. Breakfast is simple but good. They make a great cappuccino! The rooms at Albergo Piave are small but spectacularly clean, the beds are comfortable enough, and the bathrooms are very nice. The staff is helpful, although many of them speak little or no English, which can pose the occasional communication problem for the non-Italian speaker. It is important to remember that this is more of a bed and breakfast style hotel (breakfast is included in the price of the room). You will be given a key for the front gate (the hotel is on the 4th floor of an office/apartment building) and a key card for the hotel floor so that you can come and go as you please. Overall, for someone coming to Rome to really see and explore the city, Hotel Albergo Piave is a reasonably-priced, clean, and comfortable place to do so.

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel, 2-stars with the feeling of 3-stars”
Reviews.Author: bcooper30
Reviews.Content: well, first arriving to the hotel can be very scary- it doesn't look like an hotel from outside and you may be given the feeling that you got the wrong place. the elevator will contribute to that feeling also. but, overall it's a very nice hotel, the only reason for the missing star is the entrance, i guess. The room is clean, the breakfast is nice and the service is pretty good. not the ideal location in rome, but not bad also- 10-15 minutes walking to termini, 20-30 to the spanish steps, and theres a close bus station, 50 meters from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Albergo Piave - Epic fail.”
Reviews.Author: tormojenie
Reviews.Content: Personally, I hated this hotel. Usually I never write such reviews, but this... was a special treat. I booked the room for 2 of us with twin beds a month beforehand through the hotel's website. The fotos presented on the website were nothing to reality. The so called hotel is occupying a floor of the apartment building, and people, who live in this building do not like strangers coming to the hotel. It is understandable. I wouldn't neither. We arrived at 8 p.m., there was the lady (the owner's wife, it's a family business) at the tiny reception, who didn't find us at the booking list (though I have called them 3 times before arrival, saying that I was coming). The lady looked very concentrated and rigorous. Explained that she spoke no English, though pretended that she doesn't understand Russian or Slovenian (you know... you can tell when one is speaking your language).. it was ridiculous! )))) Ok... she is truly Italian ... let's let her be one ))) Eventually, after speaking on the phone with her husband, we got our room. The room was so small that 2 twins were as 1 queen size bed, pulled together. And while one was trying to move around the room, another one had to sit on the bed, cos there was no space for 2 of us at the same time. I can't say room was dirty.. but it wasn't clean... it didn't feel clean. The pillows smelled, so asked to change it, which has been done (thanks for that, by the way...). The closet smelled too, so my clothing got a bit stinking eventually. There was a lot of dust under the bed (I don't usually check floors in hotels rooms, you know, it happened accidentally that I saw it). I guess there is no need to say that the walls are so tiny, that you hear pretty much everything that is going on in the hotel. The breakfast... well... I tried one. Frankly, I don't see the need in breakfast at the hotel when you are in Rome, cos there are so many places you can go for breakfast and it is a special entertainment by it's own. But if you still need to have a hotel breakfast, do not have one in Piave - they do serve rotten ham and the coffee is terrible. The stuff... I didn't feel they were welcoming, I felt too much tension. The owner has a very special sense of humor which he expresses too often, on my opinion. And also, the have a very special alarm security system, so if you come back late at night (after 10 p.m.), you should be careful with the main entrance door, otherwise, if you open it wrong, you will wake up the owner's wife, who will appear in her bathrobe, being very unhappy. Yes, I realize quite well that in Rome there is no time to spend in a hotel room, but since you come back tired and need rest... you need to feel comfortable. And I am sorry, Piave is not the right place. After the great time we'd spent on Ischia and in Amalfy, that was an epic fail to spend our last 3 days in Piave. I guess, if you travel alone, it might be ok in the hotel, but if you are together, or family... I wouldn't recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: Happy32655
Reviews.Content: When we arrived to the address we did n ot find a Hotel sign,We had to talk through an intercom and we were immediatly let into the building We had to take an old but charming cage elevator to the 3rd floor and were greeted by a lovely young couple. beautifuly and tastfully upgraded. While the room was tiny ,it was quite functional and very clean .A pleasant place to stay. and the price was very resonable. The owner,Georgio also makes the best capucino in all of Rome that would make Starbucks green with envy. He was also helpful in arranging tours for us and making calls for us. He let us use his P.C. to Email back to our home in the U.S. Always cheerful and helpful to make our stay most comfortable. I would go back there and highly recommend this little gem to my friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel--perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: au_vixen_atl
Reviews.Content: I paid 50 euro a night which included breakfast and a queen/king size bed. The bathrooms have showers only, but are totally renovated. The breakfast is very adequate for what you get in other places also, juice, cappucino, "american coffee"--they try at least :) fresh fruit, bread, nutella, jams etc. The rooms are tiny so bring earplugs or a little noise maker for nighttime. Thats really not a problem. I think they only have 11?? rooms. Very nice staff, but they don't speak much english and I didn't speak any Italiano. But as friendly and helpful as can be. So to the nay-sayers--get over yourself. This is a great bargain. On this trip, I also stayed for 2 nights at the Londra and Cargill around the corner. Yuck! There is no comparison. For 125 euros you can keep you bathroom telephone, larger room and overly hot hotel. Let me repeat...for the money....50 euro a night...which was a special....this was the cutest little place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly fine if you don't pay full price”
Reviews.Author: Miriam08
Reviews.Content: We spend 5 days in Rome in October which proved to be a great time weather wise: warm but not too warm. Booked the Albergo Piave after a lot of researching on Tripadvisor and I was pleased with the ease of booking and instant confirmation. The location of the hotel is good - easy walk from Termini and plenty of buses into all areas in Rome if you don't fancy walking, although you can walk to e.g. Trevi Fountain in about 25 min. The neighbourhood felt perfectly safe at night and there were plenty of restaurants around although we never tried them, going more into the towncentre. The hotel itself is is a nice place, well decorated and immaculately clean. The rooms are tiny, even smaller than in places such as New York or London. We had paid only 90 Euros per night, which was fine, it would not be worth the rack rate of 150 Euro. The room looked out into a tiny courtyard and although that conjurs images of romantic Italian vistas, it is nothing like it. In fact there is no view, therefore we kept the shutters closed pretty much all the time. But you don't go to Rome for a hotelview! Also, the walls are very thin, so you do hear other guests. We were lucky as there were no noisy people staying. All the staff were very friendly, helpful and polite and breakfast was good for Italian styles. The coffee certainly wakes you up. Overall, I would stay again, but only at similar rates.

Reviews.Title: “Don't follow Tommaso's advices”
Reviews.Author: Lisbon_PortugalPedro
Reviews.Content: We stayed 6 nights at the Piave. It's a good choice if your on a tight budget. I would give it four stars if not for Mr. Tommaso's mischievous advice regarding restaurants. He recommended us an awful trattoria nearby owned by a fellow named Livio which unfortunately we tried. You'll be much better if you pick the Cantina Cantarina at Piazza Sallustio. In a word, stay here. Just don't listen to Tommaso's advices.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Stay at Albergo Piave”
Reviews.Author: AZ_Reviews02
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at Albergo Piave for 4 nights in late April 2009. I chose this hotel for the price- I got it for about 95 Euro per night. I was considering other hotels closer to many of the sites that were also much larger and had more ammenities, but the price of this hotel and its ratings are why we chose this one. After coming from Sorrento, this hotel was a bit shocking to see at first... it is in an older NY-style building and only occupies the 3-4 floors of the building. The rooms are VERY small, but clean and efficient. The hotel is run by an older man whose English is not the greatest and has a very dry sense of humor that is not for everyone. The location of the hotel is not that bad, but we did use the metro quite often to get around as it was more convenient and quicker than walking. This hotel is not in a touristy area, so things die down at night, but I always felt safe walking at night. Overall, I would recommend this hotel if you're looking to save money, but if you're willing to splurge a bit more, I would probably stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Great Bargain in Rome”
Reviews.Author: SBSCalifornia
Reviews.Content: Recently visited Italy and Albergo Piave was my first stay. Great location within a 10 minute walk to the Rome Termini. Was traveling alone, and felt very safe here. Modestly spacious room, however someone working at the hotel smoked on occasion, and it could be smelled in my room. Good breakfast. Communication with staff challenging in the evenings - english speaking staff present during daytime hours. Great gelato place a few blocks away - l Caruso on Via Collina N 13/15, and wonderful market, Pinta SRL on Via Flavia 48/50, where you can get fresh, delicious pizza and pastries.

Reviews.Title: “Great place if on a tight budget”
Reviews.Author: kinderella7
Reviews.Content: Really a great place if you're on a tight budget (all you backpackers out there!). The rooms are extremely clean. AC works perfectly (and you need AC in Rome). The shower is better than a shower you'll find at a 4 star hotel! That was my favorite part of the room. And trust me that when you walk outside all day in the heat, you want a shower that works perfectly when you come back to your room. The staff is very friendly and often asks if everything is fine. Breakfast is simple but good. They make a great cappuccino! The place is a bit far from the center if you plan on walking but all the buses pass in front of the hotel. There is a delicious little gelateria 10 seconds away from the hotel and (oddly enough) a really good Greek fast food place right around the corner. Explore the streets around the hotel because although they are very quiet, there are lots of little restaurants and food joints around. I would defintely go back if I wanted to stay at a place in a more quiet neighborhood!

Reviews.Title: “totally fine once, but wouldn't do twice”
Reviews.Author: sundaygirl2
Reviews.Content: We neither loved nor disliked the Piave. All things considered our stay was definitely more positive than negative, but we probably wouldn't stay again for the minor conveniences it did not have. On the positive side: The hotel is very nicely maintained and decorated, from the cool floors in the hallway to the breakfast room to the rooms and bathrooms. The staff is very nice. (Other reviews mentioned the woman serving breakfast not being pleasant, but I could not disagree more. She was a bit shy, but totally nice when engaged in conversation!) The room was small, but we had a toddler with us; I think the size would have been absolutely fine for 2 people only. The bed was comfortable, the TV worked well, and the bathroom was very new looking and nicely tiled. Breakfast buffet was small, but with good variety, and fresh. Both the fresh brioches and the fresh fruit were welcome treats each morning. We liked the neighborhood; it felt very local and the bus to Termini picks up a block away. The Trattoria Cadorna around the corner had good service and absolutely delicious and plentiful pasta dishes. Traveling with a small child was both the most positive and one of the negatives of the hotel. The small room gave did not provide much space for him to move around and there was no refrigerator in the room which was difficult in terms of providing our son with his regular meal and beverage schedule. BUT the staff was SO good to our son and so accommodating to us and our needs. They let us use their fridge and even provided us with milk twice a day (outside of breakfast hours) so we wouldn't have to worry about buying it. In addition, the hotel provided a travel crib in excellent condition at no additional cost. The Piave is most definitely a child friendly place! The biggest negative other than that just expressed was the air conditioning. It did not work well at all. We decided to stay in the room one afternoon to rest and escape the Roman heat, and though the air was turned on to full blast, I was actually sticky from the heat in the room. It did not matter how long the air ran or what setting it was on: the temperature bordered on uncomfortable. Another negative (picky, I know) was in the bathroom: looks great, but not completely functional. There was only space to hang one bath towel, and the shelf above the sink is curved: pretty, but not big enough for two people's toiletries because everything on the curved side slides down. The shower head was a bit blocked so water pressure and direction of spray was not the best. There were also sudden changes in temperature if water was used elsewhere. 3. The coffee at breakfast wasn't particularly good. After two tries, we skipped it all together. Finally, there was a big armoire in the room, but no drawers, so we had to live out of our suitcases. As I said earlier, except for the problem with the air conditioning, all the other "negatives" are minor, and the hotel met our needs for this trip. Taken all together, however, we would not return.

Reviews.Title: “Upsetting stay”
Reviews.Author: electricultramarine
Reviews.Content: We booked Hotel Piave as the reviews on the web were good. However I'm sad to say we had a rather unpleasant stay overall. The room was very small but fine and the owner was very sweet and jolly with my bad Italian as was the other concierge, so I am sad to have to give this straight report. A couple of days our room was not cleaned and when we inquired as to the reason we were treated very aggressively by staff which was extremely upsetting. The staff were consistently sullen and confrontational at breakfasts with all the guests which created a bad atmosphere. Rome is a very expensive location for travellers with prices that do not tend to reflect quality from the experience of friends and family so we weren't expecting much. As a quietly spoken professional couple we were very upset at our experience. I would love to recommend this hotel for the owner but am afraid it would be an overall thumbs down sadly.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Cosy Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ABHIRAI
Reviews.Content: I stayed for a night....our room was not ready at 11 am so we were politely asked to wait..but seeing the room we were happy and found it worth..it was clean decorated and tidy... the entrance is a bit rusty , the lift shaky but hotel is good enough....The staff was helping and the lady at breakfast table was a bit strange especially at the back of the guests ...The hotel is a cosy hotel and at this price quite good deal...

Reviews.Title: “Romantic place”
Reviews.Author: Chocolate-donut
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my husband for 4 nights and it was very nice experience. The room was decorated beautifully and the breakfast was lovely. Sometimes you could here voices from the corridor quite easily and there wasn't much english tv-channels, but we didn't come to Rome to watch tv. It was easy to walk to the main sights and the room rate was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tarsus75
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Hotel Albergo Piave for six nights (from July 29-Aug. 3) during our recent stay in Rome. For the money, I can't imagine a nicer, cleaner hotel in a comparable area of Rome. The Albergo Piave is a bit off the beaten path (at 14 Via Piave), but it is near-enough to anywhere one might want to go. It's about a 15 minute walk to Termini and Piazza Republica, a 30 minute walk to the historic area (Markets of Trajan, Forum, Colosseum), and less than five minutes to the nearest bus stop. To truly appreciate Rome, one must explore the city on foot and the Albergo Piave is a fine base from which to do just that. For those less inclined to walk, one can hop an over-priced cab and be most anywhere within 15 minutes or less (depending on traffic) or utilize the city's bus system, which, while seemingly daunting at first, is really quite easy if one just takes a moment to familarize oneself with a city map (the hotel will provide you with one) and then peruses the detailed signage at the bus stops (easy to understand even if you don't know Italian). In addition, there are some decent restaurants on or around Via Piave and the very-hip Friends Music Cafe just up the street from the hotel where you can enjoy a refreshing beverage after a long day of sight-seeing. The rooms at Albergo Piave are small but spectacularly clean, the beds are comfortable enough, and the bathrooms are very nice. The staff is helpful, although many of them speak little or no English, which can pose the occasional communication problem for the non-Italian speaker. We dealt with Sylvia for all business matters. She is usually there during mornings, is very polite and speaks very good English. It is important to remember that this is more of a bed and breakfast style hotel (breakfast is included in the price of the room). Thus, there is not always someone available at the front desk, especially at night. If you're looking for a place with 24-hour room service, Albergo Piave is not it. You will be given a key for the front gate (the hotel is on the 4th floor of an office/apartment building) and a key card for the hotel floor so that you can come and go as you please. The situation worked out perfectly well for my wife and I, although I admit there were a couple of occasions when I wished a concierge or at least an English-speaking desk attendant were available. Also, Thomaso, the older gentlemen who is something like the hotel's "super" , can be a bit overbearing at times, although once you get used to him, he's harmless, even rather charming. He means well, but his gruff manner and inability to speak or understand English might make him a bit off-putting to the average westerner at first. By the end of our stay, however, he had endeared himself to us. For someone coming to Rome to really see and explore the city, Albergo Piave is a reasonably-priced, clean, and comfortable place to do so. There's so much to see and do in Rome. Who has time to stay shut up in a hotel room anyway? I would happily recommend this hotel to friends and I would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Young707
Reviews.Content: May 2007. Reserved for 2 rooms with twin beds for 4 adults. Got only 2 queen beds, one bed in each room. In fact, the 11 rooms of this hotel are too small to have 2 twin beds in the rooms. 130 euro per room per day, breakfast included. Bed is a little soft for older American travelers. Asked for inside courtyard rooms and got room #10 and #11 - very quiet and cooler. Avoid facing street rooms. Unable to dial to make outside telephone calls. Was told keep dialing 6, but kept getting recording. Bathroom hair dryer AC plug did not work. Luckily our $0.45 round plug converter (not transformer converter) worked on socket for TV (unplug the TV for awhile). Elevator did not work on 3 of 5 days. Avoid taking luggage on metro subway and bus. Ask hotel for shared shuttle.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in Roma”
Reviews.Author: rjaustin926
Reviews.Content: A little tricky to find, but a very nice hotel. The rooms were newly updated and decorated. Owner and staff were very friendly and helpful. Location was good, as it was off the beaten path, but still close enough to walk or metro anywhere you want to go. Overall, a great value.

Reviews.Title: “Nice budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cian
Reviews.Content: This was a good hotel for the budget conscious traveller. The rooms are small but nicely decorated with private bathroom and all kept spotlessly clean. Don't be put off by the entrance to the Hotel. You have to go up on a antiquated lift to reach the Hotel but once inside you are greeted by friendly staff. The breakfast was sufficient. One of the reasons for staying in this Hotel was its good proximity to Termini Station. We actually walked to Termini in 10 minutes from the Hotel on our onward journey. It is nicely situated and within easy distance of all the attractions. The Hotel is in a quieter less touristy part of the city but this can be a blessing after a busy days sightseeing. I cant recall the name of the restaurant which is on your left as you leave the Hotel, but the food was to die for and I cant reasonably see how you could get a better pizza in the whole country of Italy!! Anyway would recommend this Hotel for budget conscious and close proximately to Termini and also its friendly staff and comfortable interiors.

Reviews.Title: “Very very pleased with Albergo Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LopezLopez
Reviews.Content: My husband, 2-year old son and myself stayed at the Albergo Piave for 4 nights, from the 24 to the 28 of September. The rooms are rather cosy, and that's the only negative thing I can say about this hotel. We were treated extremely well by all members of staff, including Tomaso the owner, Patrizia, Giorgio and his family and everyone we saw. The rooms yes, are cosy, but the price truly reflects this. The room was extremely clean as well as the bathroom. The bed was really comfortable and they kindly lent us a cot for our son. The shower was awesome and they even put some toiletries for your use. The continental breakfast was delicious and very satisfying; the pastries are sooooo nice, it's the one thing I miss the most about Rome. Some people have commented that this hotel is a bit out of the way. We didn't find this to be the case at all. We walked absolutely everywhere and were in the 'centre' within 15 minutes at the most (with a pushchair!!). We actually found the location to be perfect for us and appreciated being away from the most touristy areas for dinner; there are lots of restaurants around the hotel which don't feel like tourist traps, and there's even a 'La Rinascente' within 5 minutes walk. This hotel is also within walking distance to Villa Borghese. If we go back to Rome on a budget (if such a thing is possible!!!) we would undoubtedly stay at Albergo Piave again, absolutely!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: rocco73
Reviews.Content: The better thing about our staying in Rome.The city is nice and charming, but dark and dangerous-looking too, and very hot in August. We wanted everyday to go back to the hotel, where we were really comfortable. Nice people (not usual in Rome), enough breakfast, all clean and new, good conditioned. The best part of Rome, hehehe. It wasn't as expensive as we expected. Another thing is the good location in the city, near Termini Station. We really liked it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bobdibest
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel - good position in Northern Rome, a little bit of a walk from sights like the Trevi, Spanish Steps, Piazza Navona etc but for the price its perfect. The room was a good size, recently renovated with good centrally operated AC, a nice clean bathroom and swanky shower, good sized bed and TV. The only thing that let this hotel down from a 5 star was the slight rudeness of the reception staff before we left. An elderly gentleman (owner/manager?) asked us for the cash to pay, when I said we would be paying by credit card he insisted on cash (even though a sign at reception says 'Proudly Accepting Master and Visa Cards'), when I told him we didnt have it his suggestion was to go to the bank and get it. When I finally made him realise the cash wasnt there to be had, end of, and if he didnt take the credit card there would be no money to pay he told me his credit card machine was broken. Basically I left saying nothng and returned ten minutes later with my card, which I gave it to him he said 'no cash?' I said no and he took the card, magically the machine was working! It ruined the stay a little but not so much I wouldnt recommend the hotel for budget travellers!

Reviews.Title: “Comfort at a very good price.”
Reviews.Author: Dagnini21
Reviews.Content: Best features: friendly staff, nice breakfast, big bed, huge drapes that keep out sharp morning light, very quiet, and lovely bathroom. Also, economical rates, comfortable air conditioning, and safe, very convenient location: near train station and convenient to bus routes. We will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Staying at the Piave”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Great experience for the price. After the first shock of an ancient elevator. The place is supermodern clean and the people very friendly. Rememmber this is an albergo not a full hotel. Our room for 3 was very small. Very good location just blocks from Via Venetto Tommaso the weekend concierge was fabulous. The service to the airport was on time (a little more expensive than the regular shuttle) Great choice for the price

Reviews.Title: “Great choice on a budget”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hotel Piave over New Years 2006....the hotel seemed at first to be nothing special, however turned out to be a great choice for us, as we were ttravelling on a farily moderate budget. The rooms were cozy and nicely decorated with great bathroom decor.....plus they had excellent soaps and shampoo available --- which is uncommon for 2/3 star hotels in Europe. Would definitely recommend this hotel for anyone looking for a comfortable room to stay while on vacation. Though it is not directly in the city centre, it is still close enough to walk or take a taxi (about 8 euro from Trevi Fountain). The hotel staff were friendly and accomadating. Clean and newly refurbished. A good choice for a room in Rome.

HotelInfo.Name: Albergo Piave
HotelInfo.Address: Via Piave 14, 00187 Rome, Italy
